Ach, a wee bit o' puckish humor here.   I still dinnae know if those samurai 
cuid maun hae stood up tae a charge o' claymore swinging Highlanders running 
at 25 miles per hour,  led by that deil,  The Bonnie Dundee.  Methinks the 
samurai and ashigaru wuid hae been diced into callop--highland steak----by the 
three fuit long claymores and Lochaber axes--which cut off many a horse's head 
with one deft sweep!  I still want tae sweep off my SO--new kilt and all-- and 
see the Auld Hame someday!  My heart still is in the Hielands----a chasing the 
deer. LOL.  Jock Murphy
